description: Fujita T≈çko, (born May 3, 1806, Mito, Japan, died Nov. 11, 1855, Edo [Tokyo]), one of the Japanese scholars who inspired the movement that in 1868 overthrew the feudal Tokugawa shogunate, restored direct rule to the emperor, and attempted to strengthen Japan to meet the challenge of Western imperialist powers.
name: Toko Fujita
